images.caption: Figure 1:An overview of Typed-RAG. Non-factoid questions are classified by the type classifier and processed based on their type. Prompts for the multi-aspect decomposer and answer aggregator handle the unique requirements of each type. Details of the prompt can be found in AppendixA.4.

Figure 2:Mean Percentile Rank (MPR) performance comparison of LLM, RAG, and Typed-RAG on six different non-factoid question categories from the Wiki-NFQA dataset. Results are reported using different model configurations (Llama-3.2-3B and Mistral-7B) and scorer LLMs (Mistral-7B and GPT-4o mini). The y-axis represents the MPR score (%), with higher values indicating better performance.

header: Appendix BConstruction of the Wiki-NFQA Dataset

images.caption: Figure 16:Detailed process for each Non-Factoid question type. In (b) and (c),Knsubscript𝐾𝑛K_{n}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPTrepresents the extracted keywords. In (d) and (e), the single-aspect query generator creates multiple queries, and their answers are aggregated. Specifically, in (d),S⁢Qn𝑆subscript𝑄𝑛SQ_{n}italic_S italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPTrefers to single-aspect queries, whileAnsubscript𝐴𝑛A_{n}italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPTdenotes the corresponding answers. In (e),O⁢Pn𝑂subscript𝑃𝑛OP_{n}italic_O italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPTrepresents queries generated for each distinct opinion.
